biography.value:
“A rotten stump, surrounded by a swarm of chittering woodland creatures, sprouts a maw. The animals hurl themselves into the orifice.”

Stationary Predators.

A being such as a @creature[treant|MM], @creature[awakened tree|MM], or @creature[dryad|MM] can become infected in an encounter with an aberration. Over weeks of painful mutation, what remains is an enormous, slimy tree stump with clouded eyes and a gaping maw. A grotesquerie is no longer a part of its ecosystem but a canker on the landscape. It can move but rarely chooses to do so when not in combat.

Woodland Minions.

A grotesquerie suborns the will of weak-minded woodland creatures. They kill and bring back the carcasses of the higher life forms the grotesquerie craves for sustenance.

Vile Hunger.

Regardless of how many minions it takes to get the job done, a grotesquerie summons more and more until its hunger is temporarily sated. Grotesqueries are capable of swallowing human-sized creatures whole, and it slowly digests any kind of material. Given time, the stones in its gizzard pulverize flesh, bone, and metal.

Salvage p144[–]

The gizzard-stones of a dead grotesquerie are diamond-hard and may be used or sold as diamonds with an equivalent worth of 250 gp in spells or alchemical experiments.

Lore p145[–]

[[/save ability=intelligence dc=15]] (&Reference[skill=Nature]):

The seemingly harmless tree stump is a horrible abomination capable of eating and digesting human flesh.

[[/save ability=intelligence dc=20]] (&Reference[skill=Arcana]):

The grotesquerie can control swarms of animals, and it vomits forth acidic bile to destroy attackers.

GM Advice:

p145[–]

A grotesquerie might sit in the center of a large area and control more than just tiny woodland creatures. Larger beasts, or even corrupted fey, might serve the horror. In this case, the characters might think that something else is responsible for the awful conditions and multiple disappearances in the area. They'll be &Reference[rule=Surprise]{surprised} when the rotten tree trunk in the center of the clearing is the real culprit.

description.value: The grotesquerie makes two bite attacks.

Melee Weapon Attack: [[/r 1d20+8]]{+8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 ([[/damage 2d8 + 3 type=bludgeoning]]) damage and 13 ([[/damage 3d8 type=acid]]) damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is &Reference[condition=grappled] (escape DC 16). Until this grapple ends, the target is &Reference[condition=restrained], and the grotesquerie can't bite another target.
The grotesquerie calls another @creature[swarm of grotesquerie minions|GHMG] into an unoccupied space within 60 feet of the grotesquerie.
The grotesquerie orders one swarm of its minions into its maw, regaining hit points up to those the swarm has remaining.

The grotesquerie vomits acidic bile and creatures it has swallowed in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in the area, including the vomited creature, must make a [[/save ability=dexterity dc=18]] saving throw, taking 45 ([[/damage 10d8 type=acid]]) damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Any vomited creature is thrown 30 feet through the area, taking 7 ([[/damage 2d6 type=bludgeoning]]) damage and landing &Reference[condition=prone] in an unoccupied space.

If the grotesquerie has used Devour Animals, the vomit also contains a @creature[swarm of grotesquerie minions|GHMG]. This swarm lands safely in a space in the cone and takes a turn just after the grotesquerie.

The grotesquerie makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller target it holds &Reference[condition=grappled]. If the attack hits, the target is also swallowed, and the @action[grapple] ends. While swallowed, the target is &Reference[condition=blinded] and &Reference[condition=restrained], it has &Reference[rule=totalcover]{total cover} against anything that originates outside the grotesquerie, and it takes 10 ([[/damage 3d6 type=bludgeoning]]) damage and 18 ([[/damage 4d8 type=acid]]) damage at the start of each of the grotesquerie's turns. A grotesquerie can have only one creature swallowed at a time.

If the grotesquerie takes 25 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the grotesquerie must succeed on a [[/save ability=constitution dc=15]] saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls &Reference[condition=prone] in a space within 10 feet of the grotesquerie. If the grotesquerie dies, a swallowed creature is no longer &Reference[condition=restrained] by it and can escape from the corpse by using 10 feet of movement, exiting &Reference[condition=prone].
While the grotesquerie remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a rotting tree stump.
If the grotesquerie fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

activation.condition: If the grotesquerie fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

description.value: The grotesquerie starts with three @creature[Swarm of Grotesquerie Minions|GHMG|swarms of grotesquerie minions] at its command. Each swarm is the grotesquerie's ally, and it takes its turn just after the grotesquerie. The swarm obeys the grotesquerie's telepathic or verbal commands (no action for the grotesquerie). If issued no commands, the swarm defends itself from hostile creatures, but otherwise takes no actions.
The grotesquerie makes one bite attack. It can swallow instead.
The grotesquerie uses Call Animals or Devour Animals.

The grotesquerie can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The grotesquerie regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

  • @UUID[Actor.BtQp4vwduQ0g0R8t.Item.s9jDsWHwIYiGvtfg]{Bite}
  • @UUID[Actor.BtQp4vwduQ0g0R8t.Item.fBV1Ri0PsXhyKtlU]{Move}
  • @UUID[Actor.BtQp4vwduQ0g0R8t.Item.cDNP2NhzoUnug12Q]{Animal Control}
